    • Field Detail

      • lemma

        private java.lang.String lemma
        The entry's corresponding lemma.

      • matchedItems

        private java.util.Map<WordClass,java.util.Map<Variety,java.util.List<TranscriptionItem>>> matchedItems
        The entry's main data structure. The information is organised seemingly complicated at first sight. However, since one of the main purposes of a DatabaseEntry object is to intuitively present the user with all possible choices they have when transcribing an item, this way of holding the data saves a lot of sorting in the long run. Therefore, the transcription items are held inside a Map that orderes them by WordClass. The map's values are then stored in yet another map, linking Variety objects and Lists of TranscriptionItems.

      • selectedItem

        private javafx.beans.property.SimpleObjectProperty<TranscriptionItem> selectedItem
        The entry's selected item property. Its value will automatically be updated, should TranscriptionItem.select() happen to be called on any of the entry's stored items.

      • lock

        private java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock lock

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()

        A convenience getter to check whether or not this database entry actually holds any transcription information. If this function returns true and the object originates from a call to AbstractSQLiteBridge.queryDatabase(String) then this means that there was no corresponding entry for the given lemma in the database.

        Other than that, this function should not return true. If it still does then this DatabaseEntry instance has most likely just been created.

        Calling this function is preferred over getMatchedItems().isEmpty(), because getMatchedItems() will create a (superfluous) immutable instance of the currently held data structure.

        Returns:
        true if this database entry holds no transcription data; false otherwise

      • matchesMultipleWordClasses

        public boolean matchesMultipleWordClasses()
        This is getter crucial to the question whether or not multiple items have been retrieved from the database for the given lemma. It might, for instance, be possible for the word process to appear both as a noun and as a verb, resulting in different transcriptions. In that case, the user must determine which one should be used.
        Returns:
        true if the entry can be assigned to more than one word class; false otherwise.

      • getTranscriptionItemById

        public TranscriptionItem getTranscriptionItemById(int id)
                                           throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        A convenience getter that will search the entire entry for a TranscriptionItem with the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID to search for.
        Returns:
        the corresponding TranscriptionItem.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no corresponding TranscriptionItem could be found.

      • getTranscriptionItems

        public java.util.List<TranscriptionItem> getTranscriptionItems(WordClass wordClass,
                                                               Variety variety)
                                                        throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        A convenience getter that will return an immutable List of all TranscriptionItems whose WordClass and Variety match the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        wordClass - the WordClass to search for.
        variety - the Variety to search for.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable List of the corresponding TranscriptionItems.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if no TranscriptionItem matches the parameters.

        A getter for the lemma attribute. Please note that lemmata will always be stored in lower case.

        the lemma String.

      • getVarietiesMap

        private java.util.Map<Variety,java.util.List<TranscriptionItem>> getVarietiesMap(WordClass wordClass)
        A convenience getter that will return the value (i.e., the varieties Map) for the given key WordClass. Should no such entry exist, an empty Map will be created in order to avoid NullPointerExceptions.
        Parameters:
        wordClass - the WordClass whose value to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the correspondingly mapped Map object.

      • getTranscriptionsList

        private java.util.List<TranscriptionItem> getTranscriptionsList(WordClass wordClass,
                                                                Variety variety)
        A convenience getter that will return the value (i.e., the transcription items List) for the given key WordClass and Variety. Should no such entry exist, an empty List will be created in order to avoid NullPointerExceptions.
        Parameters:
        wordClass - the WordClass whose value to retrieve.
        variety - the Variety whose value to retrieve.
        Returns:
        the correspondingly mapped List object.
